intro: Rapuntium ecklonianum, commonly known as the Cape buttercup, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it often grows in moist, shady environments. It is an herbaceous perennial that can reach heights of up to 30 centimeters. The species is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
